title: Gowerton Walks

images.title: Jaggery / Gowerton railway station
images.caption: Gowerton railway station. Viewed from Station Road. Gowerton is on the West Wales Line, between Swansea station to the SE and Llanelli station to the NW.

images.title: Destroyed footbridge on River Llan near Ystrad Isaf by Nigel Davies, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Old footbridge on River Llan near Ystrad Isaf

images.title: Public footpath crosses stream near Llewitha by Nigel Davies, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Public footpath crosses stream near Llewitha

description: This inland Welsh town is often described as the gateway to the Gower Peninsula. It is located on the north western fringes of the city of Swansea. This walk in the town takes you along a dismantled railway line from the train station. You can follow the footpath east along the Afon Llan.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The long distance Gower Way passes the town, providing an opportunity to explore the Gower Peninsula on a waymarked trail. For more walking ideas in the area see the Gower Walks page.

display_address: Fairwood Terrace, Gowerton, Swansea, Cymru / Wales, SA4 3BG, United Kingdom
